comment: A variant of the definition of the transitive closure function, using instead the smallest transitive set containing ` A ` as a member, gives almost the same set, except that ` A ` itself must be added because it is not usually a member of ` ( TC `` A ) ` (and it is never a member if ` A ` is well-founded). (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 23-Jun-2013.)
